questions.question: Make this sentence a reported speech

choices.answer: They said they will finish school on the 22nd of June
They said they are going to finish school on the 22nd ofJune
They said they would finish school on the 22nd of June
They said they are finishing school on the 22nd of June

questions.question: Make this question a reported speech

choices.answer: She said that he can do whatever he wants if he had tried
She said that he can do whatever he wants if he tried
She said that he can do whatever he wants if he would try
She said that he can do whatever he wants if he wanted

questions.question: Make this sentence a reported speech

choices.answer: We said she had to go to an American university
We said she would go to an American university
We said she had gone to an American university
We said she had gone to an American university

questions.question: Make this sentence a reported speech

choices.answer: John told us that Martin would do all the exams well
John told us that Martin is doing all the exams well
John told us that Martin had done all the exams well
John told us that Martin to do all the exams well
When we want to tell about past
When we want to convey someone's message
When something start in past and still is in progress
When someone tell us about past

questions.question: Make this sentence a reported speech

choices.answer: He said he would buy a laptop
He said he has bought a laptop
He said he's just buying a new laptop
He said that he would have bought a new laptop

questions.question: Make this question a reported speech

choices.answer: She said that he can do whatever he wants if he had tried
She said that he can do whatever he wants if he tried
She said that he can do whatever he wants if he would try
She said that he can do whatever he wants if he wanted

questions.question: In reported speech, WILL goes to WOULD

choices.answer: True
False
would
may
could

questions.question: Which of these reported speech sentences is INCORRECT?

choices.answer: 'I can't come.' She said she couldn't come.
'I've won Lotto.' She said she'd won Lotto.
'I haven't been to Bali.' She said she hadn't been to Bali.
'I'll help you.' She said she helped me.
He told to me he would be late.
He told you he was going to be late.
He said he was going to be late.
He asked you if you were going to be late.

questions.question: Change this to reported speech: "I need money."

choices.answer: She said she needed money.
She said he needed money.
She told her need money.
She told her to need money.

questions.question: Which of these sentences is in Indirect speech?

choices.answer: The teacher said, "I run in the park"
The teacher is who runs in the park
The teacher said that he ran in the park
Who runs in the park?

questions.question: Which of these sentences is in Indirect speech?

choices.answer: He told us to are scared
He told us not to be scared
He told us to be scared
If this is in the test...I'm scared

questions.question: Change it reported speech: "I have never been to Japan."

choices.answer: She told him that she has never been to Japan.
She told him that she never went to Japan.
She told him that she have never been to Japan.
She told him that she had never been to Japan.
